Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with zigzag pattern in added white between pairs of white bands; to the centre, lotus bud pattern in red and white; exterior: two brown bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, no. 1220, pl. 159)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 82, no. 25, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2031) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
